intro: Coronopus coadunatus, commonly known as the slender coronopus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers arranged in a raceme, which bloom during the cooler months. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid conditions. The species is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, showcasing its resilience to variable climates.
